title: Magazine parodies at Something Awful
content:
[—-They’ve been at it again, with mixed results—-](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905042506/http:/www.somethingawful.com/d/photoshop-phriday/magazine-mayhem3.php) Some of these are funny. For creators who aren’t type savvy (compared to typophilers), the font choices are okay, occasionally hitting the nail square on the head.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905042506im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/tiredmagazine_5949.jpg)

[—-more magazine satire here—-](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905042506/http:/www.somethingawful.com/d/photoshop-phriday/magazine-mayhem3-2.php)

Courtesy of Josh “Livestock” Boruff and [www.somethingawful.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905042506/http:/www.somethingawful.com/ "www.somethingawful.com")

j a m e s
author: James Arboghast

comments.content: Pretty funny, but [anyways is not a word](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905042506/http:/stewf.blogs.com/stewflog/2006/12/anyways_is_not_.html).

True. Their english isn’t standard. The key Something Awful guys like Lotax should write a dictionary of S.A.Netlish.

I love the SMUG cover with Cheney and “HEH” word of the year!

j a m e s
